title: LaBeouf called cop a ‘silly man’ during drunken arrest: docs
text:
Handout/Getty Images Shia LaBeouf poses for a mugshot photo after he was was arrested for public intoxication in Austin, Texas, on Friday. Austin police are casting Shia LaBeouf as a drunken antagonist.
The “Transformers” star was detained Friday night after stumbling into a roadway against the light and stopping traffic with two female companions in tow, his arresting officer testified in an affidavit.
The officer, identified in the affidavit as Sgt. Jelesijevic, wrote that he observed a “strong odor of an alcoholic beverage” coming from the actor at the time he was detained at the city’s famous 6th St. nightlife strip.
“While speaking with Sgt. Jelesijevic, LaBeouf stated that if stopped by Los Angeles Police Department he typically walks away because Police had killed a friend of his,” according to the affidavit.
“And he became increasingly confrontational, aggravated, profane and verbally aggressive with Sgt. Jelesijevic throughout the stop, calling him a ‘silly man’ three times.”
After he spotted a bystander filming the incident, LaBeouf further lost his cool, puffing out his chest and attempting to walk towards the unidentified male in a “threatening manner,” according to the arresting officer.
He then turned to Sgt. Jelesijevic and continued his verbal tirade against the officer while “staring intently,” cops said.
The 29-year-old actor claimed he was a National Guard member and told the officer he needed to “do whatever the f--k you gotta do!” the affidavit reads.
LaBeouf was ultimately arrested and later charged with public intoxication.
Anthony DelMundo//POOL The actor has had a tough legal run in recent years including a June 2014 arrest in New York City for disrupting a Broadway performance of Rob Kim/Getty Images FILE - OCTOBER 09: Actor Shia LaBeouf was arrested at the Austin City Limits music festival in Austin, Texas. He was reportedly booked for public intoxication. NEW YORK, NY - JULY 24: Shia LaBeouf leaves criminal court on July 24, 2014 in New York City. (Photo by Rob Kim/Getty Images) Previous Next Enlarge His two companions were identified by police as 20-year-old Grace Alayana and 18-year-old Daytona Stanga.
LaBeouf has yet to release a public statement about the circumstances behind the arrest - though he did leave a cryptic message for his 326,000 Twitter followers.
“Bombs Away,” he tweeted, though it was unclear whether or not that was a reference to inebriation.
It’s just the latest legal drama starring LaBeouf, whose career has taken a hit after a number of bar room altercations, an accusation of plagiarism surrounding a short film he directed and head-scratching performance art stunts.
The former child star checked himself into rehab for alcohol abuse last year after a Manhattan arrest for disrupting a performance of the Broadway musical “Cabaret.”
